document.docAuthor: Ringvold, Halldis & Tandberg, Anne Helene Solberg
document.docTitle: Halirages helgae Ringvold & Tandberg 2014, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new deepwater species of Calliopiidae, Halirages helgae (Crustacea, Amphipoda), with a synoptic table to Halirages species from the northeast Atlantic

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new deepwater species of Calliopiidae, Halirages helgae (Crustacea, Amphipoda), with a synoptic table to Halirages species from the northeast Atlantic

subSubSection.paragraph: The species is named in memory of Helga Ringvold, for encouraging her children in their future endeavours.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
NORWAY : ♀ , 10.5 mm long, R / V
G.O. Sars
, cruise 11408, st. 276-030A, Nordland , slope of Moskenesgrunnen, 68°28.86’ N , 10°55.81’ E ,
1292 m
, mud, –0,87 °C, salinity 34.92‰, RP sledge, leg. H. Ringvold ( ZMBN 90142 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: NORWAY : 4 ♀♀ , 9–13 mm long, R / V G.O. Sars , cruise 10408, st. 198-003A, Troms , slope of Mulegga, 70°14.67’ N , 16°44.52’ E , 1532 m , cobbles, –0.78°C, salinity 34.92‰ ( ZMBN 88021–88024). A total of 31 slides has been made of the holotype and paratypes .

NORWAY : 1 ♀ , 10 mm long, R / V G.O. Sars , cruise 11109, st. 487-157, Nordland , W of Lofoten, 69°04.13’ N , 12°26.91’ E , 2609 m , mud, clay and gravel, –0.82°C, salinity 34.89‰; 35 ♀♀ (6 with eggs; 3 juveniles ), 3–13 mm long, R / V G.O. Sars , cruise 10408, st. 198-003A, Troms , slope of Mulegga, 70°14.67’ N , 16°44.52’ E , 1532 m , cobbles, –0.78°C, salinity 34.92‰; 6 ♀♀ , 5–11 mm long, R / V G.O. Sars , cruise 11109, st. 444-148, Troms , slope of Eggagrunnen, 71°44.4’ N , 15°14.22’ E , 997 m , cobbles, –0.73°C, salinity 34.88‰; 3 ♀♀ , 7–11 mm , R / V G.O. Sars , cruise 11010, st. 542-357, Troms , Vesthola, Egga, 70°23.69’ N , 16°58.86’ E , 1189 m , gravelly sand and sandy mud, –0.66°C, salinity 34.9‰.

BODY. Up to 13 mm long. Pereonites 1-5 smooth, dorsal posterior margin of pereonite 7 slightly bilobed ( Fig. 2B ) (also on pereonite 6 and pleonite 2 on some large specimens greater than 11 mm long). Head ( Fig. 3A ). Rostrum short; corner of cephalic lobe with small projecting tooth; eye small (can be difficult to see in preserved specimens), reniform.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 2.
Halirages helgae
sp. nov. A . Holotype, ♀, 10 mm long. B . Dorsal side, showing bilobed posterior margin of pereonite 7; paratype 1, ♀, 10 mm long.

Fig. 3.
Halirages helgae
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀, 10 mm long. A . Head. B . Antenna 1. C . Antenna 2. D . Upper lip. E . Lower lip.

subSubSection.paragraph: spines and margino-facial setae, right article 2 with a row of 6–7 stout, conical marginal spines with margino-facial row of setae.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4.
Halirages helgae
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀, 10 mm long. A . Maxilliped. B . Maxilla 1. C . Maxilla 2. D . Mandible.

Fig. 5.
Halirages helgae
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀, 10 mm long. A . Gnathopod 1. B . Gnathopod 2.

subSubSection.paragraph: groups of setae along inner face, palm of gnathopods 1 and 2 similar and slightly excavate; dactyli on both gnathopods about half length of propodus palm, with dentate inner margin.

PEREOPODS 3–7 ( Fig. 6A–E ). Coxa 3 sub-quadrate and smooth, coxa 4 posteriorly excavate, coxae 5 and 6 longer than wide, coxa 7 elliptic and smallest of all coxae; bases of pereopods 5–7 broad and posteriorly smooth. Articles of pereopods 4–7 missing on all specimens except paratype 2, which has one pereopod 7 that includes carpus; ischium short and square-shaped, merus with setae along both margins and long setae apically, carpus with setae on both margins, 7 times as long as wide, and 1.5 times as long as merus.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 6.
Halirages helgae
sp. nov. A–D . Holotype, ♀, 10 mm long. A . Pereiopod 3. B . Pereiopod 4. C . P ereiopod 5. D . Pereiopod 6. — E . Paratype 2, ♀, 9 mm long. Pereiopod 7.

subSubSection.paragraph: UROPOD 3. Missing on all specimens.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 7.
Halirages helgae
sp. nov. , holotype, ♀, 10 mm long. A . Uropod 1. B . Uropod 2. C . Telson. D . Epimeron 2–3.

subSubSection.paragraph: COLOUR PATTERN. Colour of live specimens unrecorded.
